body: This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1431)

comment_data.body: I'd move these declarations to a new header, maybe `toxav_hacks.h`.
Tox_Err_Friend_Query. Also, more generally: please fix tokstyle errors.
We don't have an enumerator for 0?
This `switch` is an `if` in disguise. Could it be an `if` instead?
Please fix errors you see on Travis.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -413,10 +466,49 @@ static uint8_t *msg_parse_header_out(MSIHeaderID id, uint8_t *dest, const void *
 
     return dest + value_len; /* Set to next position ready to be written */
 }
-static int send_message(Messenger *m, uint32_t friend_number, const MSIMessage *msg)
+
+/* Send an msi packet.
+ *
+ *  return 1 on success
+ *  return 0 on failure
+ */
+static int m_msi_packet(Tox *tox, int32_t friendnumber, const uint8_t *data, uint16_t length)
+{
+    // TODO(Zoff): make this better later! -------------------
+    size_t length_new = length + 1;
+    uint8_t *data_new = calloc(1, length_new);

comment_data.body: Given that this is a hack, we can at least make it a bit more type-safe hack. Can you change all these `void`s to `ToxAV`? You'll need to forward-declare it in tox.c so we can have a `ToxAV*` there instead of `void*`. The hack also becomes a bit more obvious that way.
This seems unnecessary. Is there no way to store a pointer to the `Mono_Time` in the object that needs it?
Why did you change the type name to all-caps?
`static`?
We could store a `Mono_Time` pointer in `RTPSession`, right?
done
done
done
put into toxav_hacks.h and the other one static
i need to check if we need the same monotime as toxav or we can use another one ...
@iphydf how can i see those locally on my system?

@iphydf travis does not show me what the problem is:

```
Running TokTok style checker
Processing ../c-toxcore/toxav/audio.c
Processing ../c-toxcore/toxav/audio.h
Processing ../c-toxcore/toxav/bwcontroller.c
Processing ../c-toxcore/toxav/bwcontroller.h
Processing ../c-toxcore/toxav/groupav.c
Processing ../c-toxcore/toxav/groupav.h
Processing ../c-toxcore/toxav/msi.c
check-cimple: user error (Parse error near token: L (AlexPn 13195 487 34) IdVar "error")
The command ".travis/$JOB script" exited with 1.
```

how can i see the actual errors and where they occur?

@@ -61,6 +63,40 @@ void logger_write(
     const Logger *log, Logger_Level level, const char *file, int line, const char *func,
     const char *format, ...) GNU_PRINTF(6, 7);
 
+void logger_api_write(const Logger *log, Logger_Level level, const char *file, int line, const char *func,
+                      const char *format, va_list args) GNU_PRINTF(6, 0);
+
+
+/**
+ * ==================================================================================================
+ * toxcore public api call to logger, used by ToxAV
+ */
+#ifndef TOX_DEFINED
+#define TOX_DEFINED
+typedef struct Tox Tox;
+#endif /* TOX_DEFINED */
+
+void tox_logmsg(const Tox *tox, Logger_Level level, const char *file, int line, const char *func, const char *fmt,
+                ...) GNU_PRINTF(6, 7);
+
+#define LOGGER_API_TRACE(tox, ...)   LOGGER_API_WRITE(tox, LOGGER_LEVEL_TRACE  , __VA_ARGS__)

comment_data.body: Clients only need to change if they want to continue logging toxav stuff. Whether anything gets logged at all is an implementation detail, so it doesn't break things. Changing toxav tests should not be a problem.

:loudspeaker: Have feedback on the report? [Share it here](https://about.codecov.io/codecov-pr-comment-feedback/?utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=TokTok).

Chatting with @zoff99 I realized that this changes callback behaviour, causing (at least) `toxav_callback_call_state` to come from `tox_iterate` instead of `toxav_iterate` like it did on release v0.2.12. Testing `a49021763ebafbc31229522fbe50904d83d80e94` from zoff's fork at https://github.com/zoff99/c-toxcore, this unsurprisingly causes deadlocks in qTox, since we have two mutexes that were locked in order A then B, and this change causes it to try to lock B then A in this one spot.

This threading behaviour change in the API seems like effectively an API change to me, even if the function signatures aren't changing. qTox could be adapted to the threading change if needed, but should this have the "api break" label? It seems like a lot more than just a "cleanup".

___
*[toxav/msi.c, line 659 at r22](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1431#-MpWk9f003yImvL6gEz4:-MpWk9f1-OmYxu7HHg6u:b-jkvhgx) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/841c3334ebe5f1802bcbbe70b4d3a3d07a7fa279/toxav/msi.c#L659)):*
> ```C
> }
> 
> void kill_call(MSICall *call)
> ```

Why was this put in the header file and static removed? It doesn't appear to be used anywhere other than msi.c


<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

___
*[toxav/msi.c, line 866 at r22](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1431#-MpWkZYHDJmivBx0dZrV:-MpWkZYHDJmivBx0dZrW:b-lgwwpa) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/841c3334ebe5f1802bcbbe70b4d3a3d07a7fa279/toxav/msi.c#L866)):*
> ```C
> }
> 
> static void handle_msi_packet(Tox *tox, uint32_t friend_number, const uint8_t *data, size_t length2, void *object)
> ```

`length2` is a bad name for a function argument. It should be `length`, and the "real length" should be something else like `real_length` or whatever.


<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

___
*[toxav/toxav.c, line 415 at r22](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1431#-MpWnDpUBsdT_A7n5qB1:-MpWnDpUBsdT_A7n5qB2:b-q2izzn) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/841c3334ebe5f1802bcbbe70b4d3a3d07a7fa279/toxav/toxav.c#L415)):*
> ```C
> }
> 
> static int toxav_friend_exists(const Tox *tox, int32_t friendnumber)
> ```

Why does this function return an int instead of a bool? There is a valid error case (tox == nullptr) but it's not really handled.


<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

@JFreegman  "why does this function return int instead of bool ..."

i remember now. because its the replacement for

https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/blob/master/toxcore/Messenger.c#L469
```int m_friend_exists()```

so i wanted to keep it as it was.

@iphydf any plans for this to be merged?

@iphydf can you check if all the `tox_lock` and `tox_unlock` calls are correct and none missing.
need a different set of eyes on those
should we adjust the milestone on this one?

commit.message: make ToxAV independent of toxcore internals.
we do not have Messenger struct anymore, uplicate random_u32 function. why is this even randomized in the first place for audio, when its later overwritten anyway?
fix: implicit conversion from ToxAV * to bool
fix: Assignment of function parameter has no effect outside the function.
fix: Assignment of function parameter has no effect outside the function.
The value of a composite expression shall not be assigned to an object with wider essential type
fix: The controlling expression of an if statement and the controlling expression of an iteration-statement shall have essentially Boolean type
fix: implicit conversion from Mono_Time * to bool
paramter should be bool not int
